case_vignette: A 3-YEAR-OLD BOY IS BROUGHT TO THE PHYSICIAN FOR THE EVALUATION OF RECURRENT SKIN LESIONS. THE EPISODES OF LESIONS STARTED AT THE AGE OF 2 MONTHS AND MULTIPLE TREATMENT OPTIONS HAVE BEEN ATTEMPTED WITHOUT SUCCESS. HE HAS ALSO HAD SEVERAL EPISODES OF RESPIRATORY TRACT INFECTIONS, ENLARGED LYMPH NODES, AND RECURRENT FEVERS SINCE BIRTH. THE BOY ATTENDS DAYCARE. HIS OLDER BROTHER HAS ASTHMA. THE PATIENT'S IMMUNIZATIONS ARE UP-TO-DATE. HE IS AT THE 5TH PERCENTILE FOR LENGTH AND 10TH PERCENTILE FOR WEIGHT. HE APPEARS ILL. HIS TEMPERATURE IS 38°C (100.4°F), PULSE IS 100/MIN, AND BLOOD PRESSURE IS 100/60 MM HG. EXAMINATION SHOWS SEVERAL RAISED, ERYTHEMATOUS LESIONS OF DIFFERENT SIZES OVER THE FACE, NECK, GROINS, AND EXTREMITIES; SOME SECRETE PUS. CERVICAL AND AXILLARY LYMPH NODES ARE ENLARGED BILATERALLY. THE REMAINDER OF THE EXAMINATION SHOWS NO ABNORMALITIES.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS THE MOST LIKELY DIAGNOSIS?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have recurring skin lesions, some of which secrete pus, and I've also experienced enlarged lymph nodes and recurrent fevers.
How old are you?
I am 3 years old.
Do you have any known allergies or chronic illnesses?
My older brother has asthma, but no chronic illnesses or allergies are mentioned for me specifically.
Have you been on any antibiotics or medications for these symptoms?
Multiple treatment options have been attempted without success, but it does not specify which medications or antibiotics have been used.
Does anyone in your family have a history of similar symptoms or immune-related diseases?
No, there is no mention of family history with similar symptoms or immune-related diseases, only that my older brother has asthma.
Final Diagnosis: Chronic Granulomatous Disease
